page.title: 09Kimbolton - Expansion
page.content: The{village plan (1977)}allows steady growth of the population by 50% to reach about 1600 by 1991,similar to the peak population of 1851. This expansion is being effected by infilling at{Stonely}- a hamlet which has evolved into a prosperous and independent suburb of Kimbolton. In{Kimbolton}itself,most of the new building has been concentrated within the former kitchen-garden to the castle, where 48 houses, mostly executive type, have been erected. Both Parish and District Councils have demanded a high standard of design to blend with the village's character. At{Newtown}a similar development has just passed the detailed planning stage. Again the lack of cheaper "starter" homes may bring short-term prosperity but in the long-term damage to the balance of the community.
